intro: Cynoglossum officinale var. virens, commonly known as blueweed or narrow-leaved bugloss, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lance-shaped, hairy leaves and produces spikes of blue to violet flowers. The plant is typically found in dry, disturbed soils and is often seen along roadsides and in grasslands. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family, which is known for its showy flowers and sometimes hairy foliage. This species is also valued for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
